paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on a germline BRCA2 mutation associated with a case of metastatic pancreatic acinar cell carcinoma.

patients.phenotype: metastatic pancreatic acinar cell carcinoma with Weber–Christian paraneoplastic syndrome

individual_records.phenotype_details: skin erythema, polyarthritis, dactylitis, febrile erythema nodosum, metastatic pancreatic acinar cell carcinoma
individual_records.evidence_sentence: In June 2019, he presented with skin erythema, followed by polyarthritis, dactylitis, and febrile erythema nodosum, and a biological inflammatory syndrome.

functional_data.summary: The BRCA2 mutation is associated with increased sensitivity to PARP inhibitors like olaparib.

variants.segregation_data: The patient has a familial history of proven BRCA2 mutation, with breast cancer in his mother and pancreatic cancer in his maternal grandfather.
variants.additional_notes: The patient had a familial history of BRCA2 mutation.
key_quotes: The final diagnosis was that of metastatic PACC associated with Weber–Christian paraneoplastic syndrome in a patient with a germline BRCA2 mutation.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper provided clear information on the BRCA2 variant.
